message.content:
cs.PL, cs.DC, cs.LO, cs.SE, cs.CR 

This paper is likely to belong to the Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-category as it introduces a new domain-specific language for describing consistency properties of parallel/distributed programs. It may also belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category as it deals with consistency in distributed systems. The paper also discusses the semantics of the language, which could place it in the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) sub-category. Additionally, the implementation of the language in the herd7 tool could place it in the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the consistency model specification language, which could place it in the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category.
